creator: hauser@acm.org
text:
May sound obvious, but mention that
"Require group admin"
can be valid simultaneously with
"Require user JohnDoe"
with OR logic.

Perhaps just extending the example with also a "Require user" statement does it.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
The logical relation of different require directives is undefined. It depends 
on the particular implementing module and on the authoritative behaviour and 
whether the requirements are spread over more than one module.

Please don't focus yourself too much on mod_auth. It's not the only module and 
starting with 2.1 in will no longer exist. (splitted there into a bunch of 
modules).

Thanks for the heads-up on 2.1.

But in general, I would guess that equivalent functions will be available also
in 2.1?
If so, IMHO, the impact of such statements is a little bit under-documented.
While relatively scant documentation is o.k. for other features, I think that
security/access control/auth needs a little bit more care.
Just saying the result of cumulating certain directives is "undefined" or "ad
hoc" depending on particular implementations scares me when it is about security.
creator: hauser@acm.org
hv@tbz-pariv.de
text:
Please document at least this behaviour:

Apache 2.2 does this if you use .htaccess files:
 "require group ..." AND "require user ..."

You need to use "Satisfy Any" if you want logical OR.
